abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Economic Recovery Loan or Credit (ERL)
            in the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia. ERL aimed to
            support the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia's
            program of stabilization and structural reforms by helping
            to finance the costs associated with the restructuring of
            the economy and facilitating the clearance of the
            country's arrears with the Bank. The structural reform
            program focussed on initial measures in: (a) fiscal
            restructuring and retrenchment; (b) banking sector reform;
            (c) privatization, enterprise restructuring and private
            sector development; and (d) liberalization of the labor
            market and adjustment of the social safety net. Bank's
            performance was satisfactory. Borrower's performance
            was highly satisfactory.  The key lessons learned were as
            folows: (a) the objectives of facilitating arrears clearance
            with the Bank and supporting economic reforms should be
            clearly distinguished and probably separated; (b) When
            dealing with a new member state, the Bank needs to be very
            careful about the signals it gives; (c) when a country is
            committed to reforms, it will implement them with or without
            conditionality; (d) difficult and painful reforms can be
            implemented only with strong political support; and (e)
            where institutions are weak, adjustment operations have to
            be accompanied by technical assistance to ensure that the
            country has the required expertise to implement agreed reforms.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery Loan/Credit
            Project supports the government's program of
            stabilization and structural reforms by financing costs
            associated with the restructuring of the Former Yugoslav
            Republic (FYR) Macedonia's economy following the
            break-up of the Yugoslav Federation. The loan/credit will
            directly facilitate the financial workout supported by the
            international community which is required for FYR Macedonia
            to clear its arrears with the Bank. The program backed by
            the loan/credit will also receive support from the IMF
            through a drawing on the Systemic Transformation Facility.
            The loan/credit will support initial measures to launch the
            reforms in four key areas: (a) fiscal restructuring and
            retrenchment; (b) banking sector reform; (c) privatization,
            enterprise restructuring and private sector development; and
            (d) freeing the labor market and adjusting the social safety net.
